intro: Thrasya seminuda, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils, where it thrives in well-drained conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it well-adapted to survive in harsh, dry climates.
